DOC.detailed_description: Urinary stone disease affect 10 % Canadian population lifetime approximately half patient another episode within ten year . Currently , patient undergo metabolic testing ( serum 24 hour urine test ) identify modifiable risk factor ; however , modifiable risk factor identify many patient , yet continue form stone . New technique must develop identify stone patient risk future recurrence ultimately develop specific prevention strategy . Urinary protein level routinely measure stone patient strong evidence protein play role etiology stone . The purpose study examine urinary serum proteins stone former compare healthy subject utilizing high throughput method , Surface Enhanced Laser Desorption/Ionization ( SELDI ) . We hypothesize unique set protein express serum urine stone patient detect SELDI . Once protein identified biomarker , specific assay similar quick affordable dipstick test may develop identify stone patient risk future stone . Ultimately , good understand stone disease help develop new prevention strategy . Comparisons : protein profile ( serum/urine ) stone patient presence stone 6 week pass . comparison stone profile stone patient control ( non-forming stone patient ) .
DOC.criteria: Controls : Ages 18 65 year age No history stone disease radiographical evidence stone ( demonstrated negative ultrasound ) No family history stone Healthy autoimmune systemic disease may affect renal function ( see exclusion criterion ) Stone patient Ages 18 65 year age Solitary stone size , location along urinary tract ( except low renal calyceal stone bladder stone ) Radiology modality prove existence stone ( ultrasound , computed tomography , intravenous pyelogram , kidneyureterbladder xray ) ALL : Pregnant female Male patient treat benign prostate hyperplasia ( BPH ) ( ongoing medical treatment surgical intervention within 6 month ) Positive urine culture Any cancer ( exclude superficial skin , brain ) Chronic Recurrent urinary infection ( prostate , cystitis , vaginosis/vaginitis ) Gross hematuria Autoimmune disease may affect renal function ( eg Systemic lupus erythematosus ) Renal dysfunction common cause : Diabetes Uncontrolled hypertension ( concurrent microalbuminuria ) ( diastolic BP > 90 mmHg ) glomerulonephritis Renal transplant Genetic stone disease ( e.g . Cystine stone , xanthinuria ) Medullary sponge kidney , renal anomaly horseshoe kidney GI disorder : Inflammatory bowel disease , short bowel Hypercalcemic disorder ( hyperparathyroidism , sarcoidosis , Paget 's disease ) Renal tubular acidosis Immunodeficient patient e.g . HIV ( indinavir stone ) Unable provide inform consent Anyone opinion investigator would inappropriate Controls : In addition criterion ... .. persistent thiazide use Family history stone ( exclude genetic factor since positive family history increase risk urolithiasis )
